evidence.text: Within six months of the Effective Date, the Jail will consult with the Monitor to draft and/or revise policies and procedures to incorporate and align them with the provisions in this Agreement.

extracted.value: Draft and revise policies and procedures to incorporate Agreement provisions within six months of Effective Date

evidence.text: Within four months of the Effective Date, and annually thereafter, the Jail will submit to the Monitor and the United States a staffing plan for security, medical, and mental health staff adequate to achieve compliance with this Agreement on the timelines set out in this Agreement.

extracted.value: Submit staffing plan to Monitor and United States within four months of Effective Date

evidence.text: The Jail will provide constitutionally adequate medical care.

extracted.value: Provide constitutionally adequate medical care to prisoners

evidence.text: To meet the requirements of this Agreement and ensure that prisoners receive constitutionally adequate medical care, the Jail will increase medical staffing by hiring sufficient additional staff with appropriate credentials (e.g., MDs, RNs, and LPNs) and increasing the hours that current staff with higher credentials are onsite on evenings and weekends.

extracted.value: Increase medical staffing by hiring sufficient additional staff

evidence.text: The Jail will ensure that the medical screening aspect is completed within four hours of admission, or as soon as practicable if there are a large number of prisoners being processed through intake, by a Registered Nurse in a confidential setting, fully documented and available to medical staff in each prisoner's file as soon as possible.

extracted.value: Conduct medical screening within four hours of prisoner admission

evidence.text: The Jail will provide constitutionally adequate mental health care and suicide prevention practices.

extracted.value: Provide constitutionally adequate mental health care and suicide prevention practices

evidence.text: To meet the requirements of this Agreement and ensure that prisoners receive constitutionally adequate mental health care, the Jail will increase mental health staffing by hiring sufficient additional staff with appropriate credentials, including psychiatrists, psychiatric nurse practitioners, and psychiatry support staff, and increasing the hours that current staff with higher credentials are onsite on evenings and weekends.

extracted.value: Increase mental health staffing by hiring sufficient additional staff

evidence.text: The Jail will ensure that the mental health screening aspect is completed within four hours of admission, or as soon as practicable if there are a large number of prisoners being processed through intake, by a Qualified Mental Health Professional to identify mental health issues, in a confidential setting.

extracted.value: Conduct mental health screening within four hours of prisoner admission

evidence.text: The Jail will ensure that all security, medical, and mental health staff have the adequate knowledge, skill, and ability to respond to the needs of prisoners at risk for suicide.

extracted.value: Implement suicide prevention training for all security, medical, and mental health staff

evidence.text: Within three months of the Effective Date, the Jail will provide quality suicide risk assessments of suicidal prisoners by a Qualified Mental Health Professional on a daily basis in a confidential setting.

extracted.value: Conduct daily suicide risk assessments for suicidal prisoners

evidence.text: The Jail will maintain a chronic care registry that identifies all prisoners receiving chronic care, the diagnosis, the date of their last visit with a physician, and the date of their next visit.

extracted.value: Maintain a chronic care registry identifying prisoners receiving chronic care

evidence.text: The Parties agree that James Conrad Welch will be the Monitor retained by the Jail to assess and report whether the provisions of the Agreement have been implemented and to provide technical assistance to help HRRJ comply with its obligations under the Agreement.

extracted.value: Appoint James Conrad Welch as Monitor for three years to assess compliance
